Package org.dyn4j.collision.manifold

Sub package of the Collision package handling contact manifold generation.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    ManifoldPointId
    Represents the identification of a specific point of a Manifold.
    ManifoldSolver
    Finds a contact Manifold for two given Shapes.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    ClippingManifoldSolver
    Represents an ManifoldSolver that uses a clipping method to determine the contact manifold.
    IndexedManifoldPointId
    Represents a ManifoldPointId that uses indexing.
    Manifold
    Represents a collision Manifold.
    ManifoldPoint
    Represents a collision point.

Package org.dyn4j.collision.manifold Description

Sub package of the Collision package handling contact manifold generation.

Once a penetration vector and depth have been found between two Collidables, the next step is to find where the collision occurred.

A contact Manifold is an object representing the surface where the two Collidables are colliding.

Manifolds have been designed to represent two types of surfaces: edge and point.

A Manifold contains a number of ManifoldPoints who represent the surface. For 2D this will either be 1 or 2 points.

A ManifoldSolver is used to obtain a collision Manifold from a Penetration object.

Only one implementation of the ManifoldSolver is provided: ClippingManifoldSolver.

Since:
1.0.0
Version:
2.2.2
Author:
William Bittle
